keyMoments.title: Saint Charlos' First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Saint Charlos makes his debut, encountering a critically injured man being rushed to hospital. He kicks the stretcher, showing complete disregard for human life.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the arc's primary antagonists and demonstrates the cruelty of the Celestial Dragons.

keyMoments.title: Charlos Takes Marie and Shoots Judy
keyMoments.description: Charlos claims Marie as his thirteenth wife and casually shoots her fiancé Judy when he objects, demonstrating the absolute power of World Nobles.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Charlos as a villain deserving of punishment and shows the hopelessness civilians face against Celestial Dragons.
keyMoments.quote: I'll take you as my thirteenth wife.

keyMoments.title: Charlos Shoots at Zoro
keyMoments.description: Angered by Zoro's disrespectful attitude, Charlos fires his gun at Zoro, who dodges and prepares to counterattack before being stopped by Jewelry Bonney.
keyMoments.significance: Nearly triggers an Admiral dispatch, demonstrating the danger of confronting World Nobles.

reveals.information: Member of the Celestial Dragons, protected by Admiral dispatch protocol
Extremely cruel and believes himself above all humanity

keyMoments.title: Peterman's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Peterman, head of the Hound Pets kidnapping gang, debuts while tailing the Straw Hats through Sabaody Park. He has learned they are traveling with a mermaid.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the antagonist responsible for Camie's kidnapping and represents the slave trade on Sabaody.

keyMoments.title: Peterman Kidnaps Camie
keyMoments.description: Peterman and the Hound Pets successfully kidnap Camie while the Straw Hats are distracted, planning to sell her at the Human Auctioning House.
keyMoments.significance: Sets in motion the rescue mission and eventual confrontation at the auction house.

reveals.information: Leader of the Hound Pets kidnapping gang that supplies the slave trade

keyMoments.title: Marie's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Marie, a nurse, debuts while helping doctors transport a critically injured man to the hospital. She is engaged to Judy.
keyMoments.significance: Represents ordinary citizens who become victims of Celestial Dragon cruelty.

keyMoments.title: Marie Taken by Saint Charlos
keyMoments.description: Marie is claimed by Saint Charlos as his thirteenth wife. She is powerless to resist due to his status as a World Noble.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the helplessness of ordinary people against Celestial Dragons.

relationships.description: Marie was engaged to Judy before Saint Charlos took her.

evolutionMoments.description: Marie and Judy are engaged and working together when Charlos separates them.

keyMoments.title: Judy's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Judy debuts while helping doctors transport a critically injured man to the hospital. He is engaged to Marie.
keyMoments.significance: Represents ordinary citizens who become victims of Celestial Dragon cruelty.

keyMoments.title: Judy Shot by Saint Charlos
keyMoments.description: When Judy tries to protect his fiancée Marie from Saint Charlos, the World Noble casually shoots him without hesitation.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that human life means nothing to Celestial Dragons and establishes the moral stakes of the arc.

relationships.description: Judy was engaged to Marie before being shot by Saint Charlos.

evolutionMoments.description: Judy tries to protect Marie from Saint Charlos and is shot for his resistance.

keyMoments.title: Camie's Dream Fulfilled
keyMoments.description: Camie fulfills her childhood dream of riding the bubble ferris wheel at Sabaody Park, a dream shared by most Fish-Men and Merfolk.
keyMoments.significance: A joyful moment before tragedy that highlights the discrimination merfolk face. Makes her kidnapping more tragic.
keyMoments.quote: I've always wanted to ride this ferris wheel! Ever since I was little!

keyMoments.title: Camie Kidnapped
keyMoments.description: Camie is kidnapped by Peterman and the Hound Pets to be sold at the Human Auctioning House because she is a mermaid.
keyMoments.significance: Catalyzes the arc's climax and forces the Straw Hats to confront the slave trade directly.

reveals.information: Childhood dream was to ride the ferris wheel at Sabaody Park

keyMoments.title: Zoro's Ignorance of World Nobles
keyMoments.description: Zoro encounters Saint Charlos without knowing the proper protocol for World Nobles, speaking to him in his typical blunt manner.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the Straw Hats are still newcomers to Grand Line power structures.

keyMoments.title: Zoro Nearly Attacks a Celestial Dragon
keyMoments.description: After being shot at by Saint Charlos, Zoro dodges and prepares to counterattack before being stopped by Jewelry Bonney.
keyMoments.significance: Nearly triggers an Admiral dispatch through ignorance of consequences.

keyMoments.title: Zoro Saved by Jewelry Bonney
keyMoments.description: Jewelry Bonney tackles Zoro and fakes his death using tomato juice to prevent an Admiral dispatch.
keyMoments.significance: Zoro learns about the Admiral dispatch protocol and how close he came to dooming everyone on the island.

reveals.information: Zoro is unaware of the World Nobles and the Admiral dispatch protocol

keyMoments.title: Bonney Saves Zoro with Tomato Juice Trick
keyMoments.description: Jewelry Bonney tackles Zoro and uses tomato juice to fake his death, preventing him from attacking Saint Charlos and triggering an Admiral dispatch.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Bonney's intelligence and understanding of World Government protocols. Her quick thinking saves all the pirates on Sabaody.
keyMoments.quote: Brother! No, my brother! He's dead! The World Noble's shot killed him!

keyMoments.title: Bonney Explains Admiral Dispatch Protocol
keyMoments.description: After saving Zoro, Bonney explains that attacking a World Noble triggers automatic Admiral dispatch, which would endanger everyone on the island.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes crucial world-building information about Celestial Dragon protection and the power hierarchy.
keyMoments.quote: If you had attacked that World Noble, an Admiral would have been dispatched here immediately! You would have doomed us all!

reveals.information: Intelligent and knowledgeable about World Government protocols, willing to help others avoid disaster
